Activity: Log in to the system, check emails for urgent requests or updates. Respond to any pressing emails, especially from @ehrv-1 regarding system access or initial documentation.
Review project documentation related to EHR integration and seasonal influenza trend analysis. Refresh knowledge of current data fields and workflows.

Meet with @ehrv-1 (EHR Vendor Liaison) to discuss the scope of system updates and modifications needed for EHR collection and influenza trend analysis.  Clarify technical specifications and identify potential challenges. @ehrv-1 Discuss the timeline of the updates and set expectations. Take detailed notes.
Based on the meeting with @ehrv-1, begin outlining the development plan for system updates. Identify specific tasks, dependencies, and estimated timelines.

Research and document the existing EHR data fields relevant to influenza data (e.g., diagnosis codes, vaccination records, patient demographics). Consult with @da-1 and @da-2 (Data Analysts) on specific data requirements for trend analysis. @PEOPLE send email to @da-1 and @da-2 asking for the definition and requirements of related data fields.

Begin working on the development environment, setting up necessary test databases and user accounts. Ensure the environment mirrors the production system as closely as possible. Consult with @dba-1 if needed. @PEOPLE send email to @dba-1 asking for the test databases and user accounts.
Initial configuration of new data fields based on the documentation from @ehrv-1 and input from @da-1 and @da-2. Focus on ensuring data types and formats are correct.
Document the configuration process for the new data fields. Create a detailed guide for future reference and troubleshooting.
Review progress, identify any roadblocks, and plan for tomorrow's tasks. Create a detailed task list for Tuesday.
